nl.nikhef.jgridstart.ca
Class LocalCA

java.lang.Object
  nl.nikhef.jgridstart.ca.LocalCA
All Implemented Interfaces:
CA
public class LocalCA
extends Object
implements CA

A certificate authority that runs locally and signs using a generated certificate.

This implementation is meant for testing.

System properties used:

  • jgridstart.ca.local.dn - distinguished name of CA certificate
  • jgridstart.ca.local.valid - number of seconds the certificates are valid
  • jgridstart.ca.local.hold - if true, isCertificationRequestProcessed(org.bouncycastle.jce.PKCS10CertificationRequest, java.util.Properties) returns false; this can be used to test the situation where a certificate isn't signed yet.

Author:
wvengen

Constructor Detail

LocalCA

public LocalCA()
        throws CertificateException,
               KeyException,
               NoSuchAlgorithmException,
               IllegalStateException,
               NoSuchProviderException,
               SignatureException
Creates a new LocalCA and generates a self-signed certificate to sign with. It is valid for an hour only.

By default, an RSA CA certificate is generated. If other key algorithms (like DSA or ECDSA) are discovered in a CSR, a new CA of that type is generated on the fly.

Throws:
CertificateException
KeyException
NoSuchAlgorithmException
IllegalStateException
NoSuchProviderException
SignatureException

getCaCert

protected X509Certificate getCaCert(String keyalgname)
                             throws IOException
Return CA certificate for key algorithm.

If no CA certificate for that key algorithm name exists, generate one on the fly.

Parameters:
keyalgname - key algorithm
Returns:
CA certificate
Throws:
IOException - when CA generation fails
